Row.Text: {1_Num} is added per turn from Renaissance cities.
Renaissance cities founded on foreign continents (New World Cities) generate additional [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points.
Landlocked cities receive a free Mint. Upon discovering Education, [ICON_PEACE] Faith produced in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital contributes to [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Landlocked cities receive a free Caravansary. Upon discovering Education, [ICON_PEACE] Faith produced in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital contributes to [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Our explorers have created a map of all the world's coastlines.
Sacrificing a a Slave has increased {1_CityName}'s Population.
We are earning {1_Science} [ICON_RESEARCH] Science per turn from Internal Trade.
We are earning {1_Science} [ICON_RESEARCH] Science per turn from [ICON_PEACE] Faith in the Capital.
We are earning {1_Gold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold per turn from Resource trades.

English cities founded after the Medieval Era generate golden age points each turn. If the city is founded on a different continent than the English capital, the golden age points are doubled. If the city is ever captured, this effect will be permanently lost.

This image of Queen Elizabeth I was painted under the aegis of the her official Serjeant painter, George Gower, in the late 1580s, the decade in which she finally defeated the Spanish threat, and assured her place as one of England’s most successful and popular monarchs. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This portrait was owned by Edward Drewe MP, one of Elizabeth’s ablest lawyers, and has remained in his family ever since. A family legend suggests that the portrait was the gift of Elizabeth herself. It is in part through such portraits that the mystique and power of Elizabeth I was conveyed in her day. As such it is not merely a portrait of a monarch, but a symbolic statement of national supremacy.
Only available to the Aztecs. Delete in a city for a chance to increase that city's population.

This unit has a chance to spawn when an Aztec melee or gun unit defeats an enemy. The slave does not require any maintentance and can build anything that a regular worker can, although at a slower rate. The slave can also defend itself from attacks. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If BNW is installed, the Slave can be sacrificed (deleted) in an Aztec city for a chance to increase the population of that city.
Can move after attacking. +25% Damage versus Wounded. [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Duration: 3 Turns[ENDCOLOR]
30% Chance to enslave defeated Enemy units.
